1221     * uniform {@code u_timeOfDay} to any float; the rate at which you change this float affects how fast the day/night
1222     * cycle occurs. This is meant to be used with {@link #fragmentShaderDayNight}. Together, they make the color
1223     * adjustment go from bluish and dark at night, to purplish at dawn, to orange/yellow and bright at mid-day, toward
1224     * red at dusk, and then back to bluish at night. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1225     * <br>
1226     * Editing this shader is strongly encouraged to fit your needs! The time-based variables st, ct, and dd can all be
1227     * adjusted to increase or decrease the strength of the effect, and their effects can also be adjusted upon v_color
1228     * and v_tweak.
1229     * <br>
1230     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1231     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1232     */
1233    public static String vertexShaderDayNight = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1234            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1235            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1236            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1237            + "uniform float u_timeOfDay;\n"
1238            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1239            + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
1240            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1241            + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
1242            + "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n"
1243            + "\n"
1244            + "void main()\n"
1245            + "{\n"
1246            + "   float st = sin(1.5707963 * sin(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // Whenever st is very high or low... \n"
1247            + "   float ct = sin(1.5707963 * cos(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // ...ct is close to 0, and vice versa. \n"
1248            + "   float dd = ct * ct; // Positive, small; used for dawn and dusk. \n"
1249            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1250            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1251            + "   vec3 oklab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *"
1252            + "     pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
1253            + "     * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n"
1254            + "   // The next four lines make use of the time-based variables st, ct, and dd. Edit to fit. \n"
1255            + "   v_color.x = clamp(oklab.x + (0.0625 * st), 0.0, 1.0);\n"
1256            + "   v_color.yz = clamp(oklab.yz + vec2(0.0625 * dd + 0.03125 * st, 0.1 * st), -1.0, 1.0) * ((dd + 0.25) * 0.5);\n"
1257            + "   v_tweak = vec4(0.2 * st + 0.5);\n"
1258            + "   v_tweak.w = pow((1.0 - 0.125 * st), 1.709);\n"
1259            + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
1260            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1261            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1262            + "}\n";
1263    /**
1264     * The fragment shader counterpart to {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}; must be used with that vertex shader. See its
1265     * docs for more info, particularly about the one uniform this needs set. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1266     * <br>
1267     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1268     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1269     * <br>
1270     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}.
1271     */
1272    public static String fragmentShaderDayNight =
1273            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1274                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1275                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1276                    "#else\n" +
1277                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1278                    "#endif\n" +
1279                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1280                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1281                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
1282                    "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
1283                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1284                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1285                    "void main()\n" +
1286                    "{\n" +
1287                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1288                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1289                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1290                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1291                    "  lab.x = clamp(pow(lab.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.x + v_color.x - 1.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1292                    "  lab.yz = clamp((lab.yz * v_tweak.yz + v_color.yz) * 1.5, -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1293                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1294                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1295                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1296                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1297                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1298                    "}";
1299
1300    /**
1301     * Takes a batch color in CIE LAB format (but ranging from 0 to 1 instead of its normal larger range).
1302     * Adapted from <a href="https://www.shadertoy.com/view/lsdGzN">This ShaderToy by nmz</a>.
1303     * <br>
1304     * You can generate CIELAB colors using any of various methods in the {@code cielab} package, such as
1305     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}.
1306     * <br>
1307     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1308     */
1309    public static String fragmentShaderCielab =
1310            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1311            "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1312            "precision mediump float;\n" +
1313            "#else\n" +
1314            "#define LOWP \n" +
1315            "#endif\n" +
1316            "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1317            "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1318            "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1319            "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1320            "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1321            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1322            "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1323            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1324            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
1325            "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1326            "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1327            "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
1328            "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1329            "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1330            "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
1331            "{\n" +
1332            "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
1333            "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
1334            "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
1335            "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
1336            "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
1337            "    return lab;\n" +
1338//            "    return vec3(lab.x, length(vec2(lab.y,lab.z)), atan(lab.z, lab.y));\n" +
1339            "}\n" +
1340            "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1341            "{\n" +
1342//            "    c = vec3(c.x, cos(c.z) * c.y, sin(c.z) * c.y);\n" +
1343            "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
1344            "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
1345            "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
1346            "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
1347            "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
1348            "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
1349            "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
1350            "    return rgb;\n" +
1351            "}\n" +
1352            "void main()\n" +
1353            "{\n" +
1354            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1355            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1356            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1357            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1358            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1359            "}";
1360
1361    /**
1362     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1363     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1364     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1365     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There can be some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1366     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1367     * <br>
1368     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1369     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1370     * <br>
1371     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1372     */
1373    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1374            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1375                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1376                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1377                    "#else\n" +
1378                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1379                    "#endif\n" +
1380                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1381                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1382                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1383                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1384                    "void main()\n" +
1385                    "{\n" +
1386                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1387                    "//// Ugly repeated matrix math to convert from RGB to Oklab. Oklab keeps lightness separate from hue and saturation.\n" +
1388                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1389                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1390                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1391                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1392                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1393                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1394                    "//// Sharply increases lightness contrast, to counteract the gray-ing caused by averaging base and tint lightness.\n" +
1395                    "  tint.x = (tint.x + base.x) - 1.0;\n" +
1396                    "  tint.x = sign(tint.x) * pow(abs(tint.x), 0.7) * 0.5 + 0.5;\n" +
1397                    "//// Uncomment these next 3 lines if you want the original image to contribute some color, if it has any.\n" +
1398                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1399                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1400                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1401                    "//// Reverse the Oklab conversion to get back to RGB. Uses the batch color's alpha normally.\n" +
1402                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1403                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1404                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1405                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1406                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1407                    "}";
1408
1409    /**
1410     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1411     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1412     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1413     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1414     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1415     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1416     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1417     * <br>
1418     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1419     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1420     * <br>
1421     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1422     */
1423    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1424            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1425                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1426                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1427                    "#else\n" +
1428                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1429                    "#endif\n" +
1430                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1431                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1432                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1433                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1434                    "void main()\n" +
1435                    "{\n" +
1436                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1437                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1438                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1439                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1440                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1441                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1442                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1443                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1444                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1445                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1446                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1447                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1448                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1449                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1450                    "}";
1451    /**
1452     * The simplest possible color-inverting shader for a SpriteBatch, this just takes each RGB channel and subtracts it
1453     * from 1.0 to get the value this uses. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1454     * <br>
1455     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1456     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1457     * <br>
1458     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1459     */
1460    public static final String fragmentShaderInvertedRGB =
1461            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1462                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1463                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1464                    "#else\n" +
1465                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1466                    "#endif\n" +
1467                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1468                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1469                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1470                    "void main()\n" +
1471                    "{\n" +
1472                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1473                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(1.0 - tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1474                    "}";
1475
1476    /**
1477     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedRGB}, but internally converts to Oklab, so it can invert just lightness
1478     * without changing color hue or saturation. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1479     * <br>
1480     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1481     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1482     * <br>
1483     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1484     */
1485    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedLightness =
1486            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1487                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1488                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1489                    "#else\n" +
1490                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1491                    "#endif\n" +
1492                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1493                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1494                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1495                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1496                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1497                    "        const float shape = 0.64516133, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1498                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1499                    "        float r = mix(\n" +
1500                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1501                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1502                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1503                    "        return r * r;\n" +
1504                    "}\n" +
1505                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1506                    "        const float shape = 1.55, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1507                    "        L = sqrt(L);\n" +
1508                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1509                    "        return mix(\n" +
1510                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1511                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1512                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1513                    "}\n" +
1514//                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1515//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 - L * 0.4285714) + 1.0;\n" +
1516//                    "}\n" +
1517//                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1518//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 + L * 0.75) + 1.0;\n" +
1519//                    "}\n" +
1520                    "void main()\n" +
1521                    "{\n" +
1522                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1523                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1524                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1525                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1526                    "  lab.x = fromOklab(1.0 - toOklab(lab.x));\n" +
1527                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1528                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1529                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1530                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1531                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1532                    "}";
1533
1534    /**
1535     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedLightness}, but instead of inverting lightness, this tries to change only
1536     * hue, without changing lightness or (generally) saturation. This works internally by negating the A and B
1537     * components of the color (as Oklab). This uses an RGBA batch color.
1538     * <br>
1539     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1540     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1541     * <br>
1542     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1543     */
1544    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedChroma =
1545            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1546                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1547                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1548                    "#else\n" +
1549                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1550                    "#endif\n" +
1551                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1552                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1553                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1554                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1555                    "void main()\n" +
1556                    "{\n" +
1557                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1558                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1559                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1560                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1561                    "  lab.yz = -lab.yz;\n" +
1562                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1563                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1564                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1565                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1566                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1567                    "}";
1568    /**
1569     * This is similar to the default vertex shader from libGDX, but also does some expensive setup work for HSLuv batch
1570     * colors per-vertex instead of per-fragment. It is needed if you use {@link #fragmentShaderHsluv}.
1571     */
1572    public static final String vertexShaderHsluv =
1573            "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1574            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1575            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1576            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1577            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1578            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1579            +
1580            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1581            "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1582            "const mat3 m =" +
1583            "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1584            "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1585            "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1586            "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1587            "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1588            "}\n" +
1589            "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1590            "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1591            "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1592            "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1593            "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1594            "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1595            "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1596            "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1597            "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1598            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1599            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1600            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1601            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1602            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1603            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1604            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1605            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1606            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1607            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1608            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1609            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1610            "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1611            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1612            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1613            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1614            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1615            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1616            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1617            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1618            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1619            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1620            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1621            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1622            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1623            "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1624            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1625            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1626            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1627            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1628            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1629            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1630            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1631            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1632            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1633            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1634            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1635            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1636            "        return mn;\n" +
1637            "}\n" +
1638            "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1639            "{\n" +
1640            "    float L = c.z;\n" +
1641            "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
1642            "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
1643            "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
1644            "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
1645            "}\n"
1646            + "void main()\n"
1647            + "{\n"
1648            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1649            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1650            + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831;\n"
1651            + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
1652            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1653            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1654            + "}\n";
1655
1656    /**
1657     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderOklab}, but uses the HSLuv color space instead of the Oklab one.
1658     * This also gamma-corrects the inputs and outputs, though it uses subtly different math internally.
1659     * <br>
1660     * You can generate HSLuv colors using any of various methods in the {@code hsluv} package, such as
1661     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv.ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)}.
1662     * <br>
1663     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShaderHsluv}.
1664     */
1665    public static String fragmentShaderHsluv =
1666            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1667                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1668                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1669                    "#else\n" +
1670                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1671                    "#endif\n" +
1672                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1673                    "varying vec4 v_color;\n" +
1674                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1675                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1676                    "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1677                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1678                    "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1679                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1680                    "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1681                    "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1682                    "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.19783000664283681, 0.468319994938791);\n" +
1683                    "const mat3 m =" +
1684                    "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1685                    "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1686                    "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1687                    "const mat3 mInv =\n" +
1688                    "         mat3(0.41239079926595948 , 0.35758433938387796, 0.180480788401834290,\n" +
1689                    "              0.21263900587151036 , 0.71516867876775593, 0.072192315360733715,\n" +
1690                    "              0.019330818715591851, 0.11919477979462599, 0.950532152249660580);\n" +
1691                    "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1692                    "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1693                    "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
1694                    "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1695                    "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1696                    "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1697                    "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1698                    "}\n" +
1699                    "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1700                    "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1701                    "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1702                    "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1703                    "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1704                    "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1705                    "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1706                    "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1707                    "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1708                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1709                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1710                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1711                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1712                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1713                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1714                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1715                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1716                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1717                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1718                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1719                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1720                    "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1721                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1722                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1723                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1724                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1725                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1726                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1727                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1728                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1729                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1730                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1731                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1732                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1733                    "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1734                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1735                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1736                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1737                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1738                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1739                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1740                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1741                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1742                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1743                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1744                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1745                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1746                    "        return mn;\n" +
1747                    "}\n" +
1748                    "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1749                    "{\n" +
1750                    "    c *= mInv;" +
1751                    "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
1752                    "    vec2 uv;\n" +
1753                    "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
1754                    "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
1755                    "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
1756                    "}\n" +
1757                    "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
1758                    "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1759                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1760                    "        return mix(\n" +
1761                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1762                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1763                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1764                    "}\n" +
1765                    "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
1766                    "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1767                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1768                    "        return mix(\n" +
1769                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1770                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1771                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1772                    "}\n" +
1773                    "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1774                    "{\n" +
1775                    "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
1776                    "    float U = c.y;\n" +
1777                    "    float V = c.z;\n" +
1778                    "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
1779                    "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
1780                    "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
1781                    "      lim /= len;\n" +
1782                    "      U *= lim;\n" +
1783                    "      V *= lim;\n" +
1784                    "    }\n" +
1785                    "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
1786                    "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
1787                    "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
1788                    "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
1789                    "    } else {\n" +
1790                    "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
1791                    "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
1792                    "      } else {\n" +
1793                    "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1794                    "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
1795                    "      }\n" +
1796                    "    }\n" +
1797                    "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
1798                    "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
1799                    "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
1800                    "    c.x = 2.25 * varU * c.y / varV;\n" +
1801                    "    c.z = (3. / varV - 5.) * c.y - (c.x / 3.);\n" +
1802                    "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
1803                    "    return rgb;\n" +
1804                    "}\n" +
1805                    "void main()\n" +
1806                    "{\n" +
1807                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1808                    "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1809                    "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(luv.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
1810                    "  luv.yz = (luv.yz) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
1811                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1812                    "}";
1813}
